alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 12:05PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...A WINTRY MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW THIS AFTERNOON WITH GUSTY SOUTHERLY WINDS... Colder air will move up Cook Inlet and the Western Kenai Peninsula to Anchorage and the Mat-Su with a wintry mix of rain and snow from the northern Kenai Peninsula north to the Mat-Su Valley. There may be some minor wet snow accumulation for areas near sea level, with higher amounts in the mountains as well as over the northern to western Susitna Valley. Expect a brief period of lower visibilities for any snow that moves through. In addition, the combination of rain and snowmelt and poor drainage are causing ponding on roadways and minor flooding. Gusty southerly winds will accompany the colder air. The strongest winds will be along Kachemak Bay and Cook Inlet on up into Anchorage, with gusts of 30 to 40 mph along Kachemak Bay and 20 to 30 for the remainder of the area. Gusty winds will gradually decrease through this evening. Temperatures will drop below freezing tonight causing any water and slush along roadways to freeze up.

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
